newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Rugby union-ACT name makeshift side to face French.
newsitem.headline: Rugby union-ACT name makeshift side to face French.

text.p: ACT rugby union officials have named a President's XV to play France in a tour match at Bruce Stadium on Friday.

Seven Brumbies regulars -- winger Joe Roff, scrumhalf George Gregan, centre Pat Howard, flanker and captain Brett Robinson, second rower David Giffin, prop Ewen McKenzie and hooker Marco Caputo -- are missing because of test duty.
All seven were named by Wallaby coach Greg Smith for the first test against the Five Nations champions in Sydney on June 21.

15-Rod Kafer (captain); 14-Mitch Hardy, 13-James Holbeck, 12-Geoff Logan, 11-Liam O'Connor; 10-David Knox, 9-Andrew Cairns; 8-Owen Finegan, 7-Ipolito Fenukitau, 6-Troy Jaques, 5-Justin Harrison, 4-John Langford, 3-Dean Zammit, 2-Timote Tavalea, 1-Patricio Noriega.
Reserves: Andrew Obad, Nick Scrivener, John Ross, Craig Sweeny, Rod Moore, James McCormack.
